paragraphs.content: Chapter 57
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 57

paragraphs.content: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.

paragraphs.content: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.

paragraphs.content: ¶ But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.

paragraphs.content: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,

paragraphs.content: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?

paragraphs.content: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?

paragraphs.content: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.

paragraphs.content: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.

paragraphs.content: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.

paragraphs.content: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.

paragraphs.content: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?

paragraphs.content: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.

paragraphs.content: ¶ When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;

paragraphs.content: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.

paragraphs.content: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.

paragraphs.content: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.

paragraphs.content: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.

paragraphs.content: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the LORD; and I will heal him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the Lord; and I will heal him.

paragraphs.content: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.

paragraphs.content: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
